column4: lapinux: system monitor takes up some CPU refreshing the lists all the time
its a constant 5 to 50% between the 4 cpu's, they jump back and forth
go to the processes tab, click view -> all processes, and sort by CPU column.
Xorg is using 43 to 51% cpu, is that normal
no it isn't. have you tried restarting the X server? (ctrl alt backspace)
doing anything impressivly kick-ass to X? like, I don't know, several graphs or moving graphics, etc
well, i was watching the moving graph in system monitor, i just switched to a different tab and it dropped off
im stunned that it was that much though
depends on hwo big the graph is. I know it eats half of mine when I maximize the window
all I can say is ouch  ;)
i saw that graph and was like, what the heck, and the processes tab wasnt matching up
